text: The women's shot put competition of the athletics events at the 1979 Pan American Games took place on 9 July at the Estadio Sixto Escobar.Full results The defending Pan American Games champion was María Elena Sarría of Cuba. ==Records== Prior to this competition, the existing world and Pan American Games records were as follows: {| class="wikitable" |- |World record | |22.32 |Nitra, Czechoslovakia |August 20, 1977 |- |Pan American Games record | |18.03 |Mexico City, Mexico |1975 |} ==Results== All distances shown are in meters. {| class="wikitable" style="margin:0.5em auto; font- size:90%;position:relative;" width=68% |- |KEY: |align=center|WR||World Record |align=center|GR||Pan American Record |} ===Final=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Rank !Name !Nationality !Distance !Notes |- | |María Elena Sarría | |18.81 |GR |- | |Maren Seidler | |18.57 | |- | |Carmen Ionesco | |16.50 | |- |4 |Ann Turbyne | |16.45 | |- |5 |Hilda Ramírez | |15.96 | |- |6 |Lucette Moreau | |14.90 | |- |7 |Victoria López | |12.36 | |- | |Patricia Andrus | | | |} ==References== Category:Athletics at the 1979 Pan American Games 1979
title: Athletics at the 1979 Pan American Games – Women's shot put
